Description: Extremely rare left handed 1985 Made in Japan 62 reissue double bound Fender Custom Telecaster in the original three tone sunburst finish on a solid Alder body. She's an all natural and true relic with honest play wear and the original A serial ashtray bridge and original knurled '60s reissue saddles. This guitar features the 4 Tone Tele Series mod, with both pickups together as a humbucker.This guitar was handmade in the Fuji-Gen Gakki guitar factory in Japan of amazing craftsmanship. The original Fender Japan maple neck has a medium C profile with 7.25" fret board radius, 6230 Fender frets, 1 11/16" graphtec nut width, and neck thickness of .84"/.92". The original made in Japan Fender Gotoh tuners are in excellent working condition with original string tree and Tadeo Taper on back of headstock volute.She's all original with the exception of the series mod, CRL switch, and upgraded cloth wiring by Sayoko Kuwabara of Fender Custom Shop. It rivals a Custom Shop Fender or Nash Guitar in the $3500 - $4500 range, weighs a light 7.6 lb, and ships in a free tweed hardshell case. This guitar was made at a time when Fender wasn't making guitars in the USA, and it sold new for the equivalent of $1300+ without a hard case or any upgrades. In addition, this is an extremely rare Alder body model (nearly all of these are basswood).This guitar will be securely packed and shipped in a free tweed hardshell case, with full insurance and signature confirmation.I offer fast same-day handling and 13+ years on eBay. Please view my 100% positive feedback and buy with confidence.Each guitar from my collection is unique, and once sold, its history. Don't hesitate, buy it now today!
Title: Lefty 1985 Vintage Fender 62RI Custom Telecaster Bound Left Handed Relic Guitar
ConditionDescription: 4 Tone Tele Series mod (both pickups together as a humbucker). Extremely rare Alder body model. Weighs a light 7.6 lb, hardshell case included.
